# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_str, " ")
    wrapped_str = ""

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        end
        wrapped_str *= word * " "
    end

    wrapped_str
end

# Example
input_str = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped to fit within a maximum `text_width` of 10 characters."
wrapped_str = wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10))
println(wrapped_str)
```
The example demonstrates how the `wrap_string` function wraps a string by adding new lines when necessary to not exceed a maximum `text_width`.
